title: Everyone just ban zed until he has a 100% ban rate

replies.body: To be fair, his win rate went down by a solid 2-3% after patch 6.11, leaving him with 47%. And if you're gonna argue that he's banned most of the time, he still has a fair 6% pick rate. He's notably weaker than before, I think he's fine.

He isn't banned for being broken, he's banned for being anti-fun.

Just google the reasons why he's considered anti-fun. There are plenty of people who've already explained it better than I could.
Does this mean if an opponent plays zedd i can report him for giving me a negative game experience?

> if an opponent plays zedd

I'm not trying to make fun of you but...

Zed, Zedd, and Zeddy:
http://s33.postimg.org/lzwz7terz/zed_zedd_n_zeddy.png

First thing that came to mind

Well if you will automatically hate champions that encapsulate poke and mobility, there's nothing Riot can do. They can perform as terribly as you can imagine, they can have all sort of weaknesses you will ignore, they have a flashy kit and can't run oom, anti-fun.
and 100-0 and safe farming
Everyone can farm safely, even without mobility. Just like everyone is a little vulnerable after using their abilities to "farm safely".
I would like to know how full melee champions can farm safely

By having access to hard CC, ranged abilities or sustain. 

I'm curious why Yasuo wouldn't be considered "full melee champion" btw.

Does that mean Garen, Maokai, Malphite, Tahm Kench, and (insert melee tank here) can farm safely against Gnar?

Nope. They can't. The only time they can is when Gnar isn't there.
As long as you acknowledge Yas, Fizz and probably even Zed can't farm safely against him either.

You do realize Yasuo hard counters Gnar, right? If Yasuo blocks Gnar's Q with W, Gnar cannot reset its cooldown, and he instantly lost the majority of his poke damage. When that happens, Yasuo can easily abuse Gnar.

Zed can always farm safely with his skills. He might lose some cs, but definitely still safe because Gnar can't force Zed out of lane. I would agree with Fizz though.

Oh yeah, that's a matchup. Well, derp. Gnar will be more useful for his team, I guess? It's not like Yasuo will be able to deny a resourceless ranged champ like Gnar (or be able to fight Mega Gnar).

Gnar v Zed is another story though. The tanks you mentioned all have some way of weathering the storm against Gnar poke. Zed will get poked or miss CS when the wave starts to push. He might get poked less than them but he's less durable then they are too.

Yes, yes you can deny a tank that relies heavily on gold to survive the enemy's DPS (as with most, if not all tanks)

I did say that Zed will still be pressured. He'll just have a better time because of his ranged skills. He may not be as durable, but most tanks can't even farm and can only get some exp because the moment they walk in to CS, Gnar's going to poke them hard. Plus, Zed won't be too worried about Mega Gnar because he can't reach Zed that easily, while tanks will really suffer.

Not as Yasuo you can't. That champion needs a lead to be anything and that's something Gnar definitely won't give him. Gnar might need gold but Yasuo needs it more.

Like I said, "most tanks" have access to something like Malphite passive, Maokai passive, Garen passive, Sion W, Tahm E (passive) and that's all the top lane tanks I could think off. Unless Zed has the wave constantly pushed towards Gnar, he won't be able to farm from range, ergo, he'll miss farm.

How? Yasuo will either get a Zeal that will turn him into a pure splitpusher or the  Triforce vs Gnar's cheaper Cleaver. Gnar might be a worse tank when on even grounds with others but he's definitely a better tank and initiator than Yasuo.

So are Malphite and Garen zoned from CS or not? If it's the former, their passives will reset.

Sion can easily get an early FH or IBG?

About Tahm? What? What? He activated his E so he won't get health regen but ... didn't?

Yasuo's Q has 400 and something range, and the tornado has pretty high range as well.

Having hard CC doesn't allow you to safely farm, unless that hard CC isn't gated by resources (stay weak {{champion:92}} )

I'd love to see a Yasuo farm with nothing but Q, that would be way too fun to watch.

Of course CC  helps. You walk forward and use said CC when people try to punish you. Using it won't make you instantly run oom either sooooo...
Dude if you are playing Yasuo against Azir that is the only way you can farm. It's certainly not hard.
Yasuo against Azir sounds like a lost lane if I've ever seen one.
Yasuo vs Azir is the definition of "you either outskill your opponent by 5 elos or there is nothing you can do."
I agree. Zed is not an overpowered champion, but rather an over-oppressive champion

the only problem I have with him is the fact that he has an extremely strong long-range poke without putting himself in danger, which should not be in the kit of an assassin. The other stuff is okay since he is supposed to kill people fast.

Why isn't Kennen being banned than? At least I can survive the majority of laning phase vs Zed, even if I'm a squishy with low mobility. By the time he hits 6, I'll be close enough to Zhonyas that he won't be able to 100-0 me, or even 70-0 me (as a veigar). However, Kennen does an incredibly amount of damage early, is a safe laner to play, and has a passive with an easily proced stun. And Kennen is manaless, has an equally un-fun ult to play against, and can snowball other lanes too easily.

Kennen has no reall gap closer outside his  E which is only a gap closer due to mobility steroid. It also requires him to run into you putting him in a dangerous range of anyone who is good at melee combat. He also has to hit you with his passive 3 times so his CC is not instant. You will likely see it coming. His ultimate also puts him right dab in the middle of a teamfight with no real way out unless enough enemies die or are attempting to flee afterwards.
I can't. Other people ban it before it's my turn.
Go for Fizz then, he's definitely the next in line.
I just ban Graves and move along. Top lane doesn't need to be top lame.

personally, as i wrote in a comment belowI don't find Zed worth banning anymore,-,
 If you keep banning a champ because you don't want to play vs him since he is annoying or Anti-fun then you are never going to learn how to deal with him when he is picked against you.
Like seriously if you hate playing vs Zed then maybe learn a few tips and tricks you can use against them so when he is picked you won't be feeding your hatred for the champ. (because that is your own damn fault >_>)
as for anti-fun I can name many other champs that are more Anti-fun than Zed, but in all seriousness this is personal preference

i don't get all the zed hate really.
I know he can be annoying but all these QQ posts are kinda getting a lil repetitive....
Why can't we go and QQ about how broken LB is or something...;/
Imagine is Zed was a real person...gosh i feel so bad for him.

I hate Zed because he sucks the fun out of the game for the other team. This has nothing to do with him being strong or weak (though overload is defiantly a factor). It also has nothing to do with my ability to play against him. I can lane against him just fine - that doesn't make it any more fun.
Other champions I don't like because they're simply incredibly unfun to deal with:
- Tryndamere and Susan. Because baby-sitting top lane for 50 minutes if "fun".
- Kalista and Kench. Their shared ability is ridiculously jarring.
- Kalista. Also because of her passive and back-loaded damage.
- Yasuo. When champions are given weaknesses and counter-play, they shouldn't become a newb-trap when playing against good ones.
- LeBroke. Getting 100-0'ed in under a second from 800 range away. Also, the tether: can we *please* make the refresh rate on that thing *less* forgiving?
- Rengar. Speaking of 100-0'ed in under a second. This one stars out *invisible*.
- Quinn. Q.
- Nidalee. Near impossible to catch. Chucks ICBM's from 1500 range on 4 second CD. If I wanted to play a bullet hell, I'd play Tahou.
- ~~Teemo~~ Satan. F'ing shrooms.
balance*
